div1.head: Newspaper clipping, The Havana Post, June 26, 1900
div1.p:
United States Wants to Locate Origin
of Yellow Fever.

A Commission Composed of Eminent Doc-
tors Will Study Disease in All Its Phases
at Quemados and Havana--Two Doctors
From Washington Are on the Board.

The United States government is send-
ing another commission to Cuba to study
yellow fever in an effort to discover its
true origin. The commission will arrive
in Cuba within the next few days and
will spend the entire summer at Quema-
dos, coming to Havana occasionally in
the interest of the work. The commis-
sion is composed of Major Walter Reed,
head of the army and navy medical mu-
seum at Washington; and one of the
most noted bacteriologists of the
United States, Dr. James Carrol, U.S.A.,
Dr. Agramonte, U. S. A., and Dr. Jesse
W. Lazear, the latter two being on duty
in Cuba.

The commission will study all tropical
diseases and will endeavor to study yel-
low fever as it never has been studied
before. For this work the United States
government has made an appropriation
which will meet all of the expense of the
research and experiment to be made.

The two investigators who are coming
from the United States will bring with
them all of the testing instruments need-
ed for the purpose of studying the dis-
ease in all of its phases. The United
States has frequently made a study of
yellow fever, which has menaced her
southern coast for so many years, and
last year a commission from the marine
hospital was sent to Cuba and rendered
a lengthy report to Surgeon General
Sternberg on the origin of the disease.
The coming of the commission to Cuba
is considered important, as much so for
Cuba as for the United States.

While the commission is pursuing its
labors it will have the assistance of all
the surgeons in the department of Ha-
vana and Pinar del Rio.
